N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 578.15 - Recoveries of expense

State Regulations

Operating costs shall be reduced by the cost of services and
activities which are not properly chargeable to resident care. In the event
that the commissioner determines that it is not practical to establish the
costs of such services and activities, the income derived therefrom may be
substituted for costs of these services and activities. Such activities and
services covered by this provision include: (a) drugs and supplies sold for use outside
the residential treatment facility; (b) discount on purchases; (c) living quarters rented to
employees; (d) employee
cafeterias; (e) meals provided to
special nurses or residents' guests; (f) operation of parking facilities for
community convenience; (g) lease of
office and other space of concessionaires providing services not related to
resident service; and
(h) tuitions
and other payments for educational services, room and board, and other services
not directly related to resident service. Notes
